intro: Avenula praeusta, commonly known as the slender sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Native to wetland and marshy habitats, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and is often found in temperate regions. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and riparian ecosystems.
